1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		ModuleCmd_Init.c				     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	Routines that act on a user's "dot" startup files to **
14   |  **			add, remove, and list modulefiles to/from/in their   **
15   |  **			startup files.					     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Exports:		ModuleCmd_Init					     **
18   |  ** 									     **
19   |  **   Notes:								     **
20   |  ** 									     **
21   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
22   |  ****/
23   | 
24   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
25   |  ** 									     **
26   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
27   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
28   |  ** 									     ** 
29   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
30   | 
31   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: ModuleCmd_Init.c.src.html,v 1.9 2009/09/02 20:37:39 rkowen Exp $";
32   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
33   | 
34   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
35   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
36   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
37   | 
38   | #include "modules_def.h"
39   | 
40   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
41   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
42   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
43   | 
44   | /** not applicable **/
45   | 
46   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
47   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
48   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
49   | 
50   | /** not applicable **/
51   | 
52   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
53   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
54   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
55   | 
56   | /** not applicable **/
57   | 
58   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
59   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
60   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
61   | 
62   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
63   | 
64   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
65   | static	char	_proc_ModuleCmd_Init[] = "ModuleCmd_Init";
66   | #endif
67   | 
68   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
69   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
70   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
71   | 
72   | /** not applicable **/
73   | 
74   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
75   | /**				    STATIC FUNCTIONS			     **/
76   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
77   | 
78   | /* Handles the output of a substring where the start & ending positions
79   |  * are given - if either is NULL then just do nothing and return -1
80   |  * all other cases it returns 0
81   |  */
82   | static int out_substr(FILE *stream, char *start, char *end) {
83   | 	char save;
84   | 
85   | 	if (!start || !end) return -1;
86   | 
87   | 	save = *end;
88   | 	*end = '\0';
89   | 	fputs(start, stream);
90   | 	*end = save;
91   | 	return 0;
92   | }
93   | 
94   | 
95   | /*++++
96   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
97   |  ** 									     **
98   |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_Init					     **
99   |  ** 									     **
100  |  **   Description:	Execution of the module-command 'init'		     **
101  |  ** 									     **
102  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
103  |  ** 									     **
104  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
105  |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
106  |  **			char 		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
107  |  ** 									     **
108  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
109  |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
110  |  ** 									     **
111  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
112  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
113  |  **					control everything		     **
114  |  ** 									     **
115  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
116  |  ++++*/
117  | 
118  | int	ModuleCmd_Init(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
119  | 	       		int            	 argc,
120  | 	       		char		*argv[])
121  | {
122  |     char	 *home_pathname,
123  | 		 *home_pathname2,
124  | 		 **shell_startups;	/** A list off all startup files our **/                                        /** invoking shell will source       **/
125  |     Tcl_RegExp	 modcmdPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp,
126  | 	"^([ \t]*module[ \t]+)(load|add)[ \t]+([^#\n]*)([#.\n]*)");
127  |     char	**modlist,
128  | 		 *home,
129  | 		 *buffer,
130  | 		  ch,
131  | 		 *startp, *endp;
132  |     FILE	 *fileptr, *newfileptr;
133  |     int		  i, j,
134  | 		  found_module_command = 0,
135  | 		  found_modload_flag = 0,
136  | 		  shell_num = 0,
137  | 		  final_list_num = 0,
138  | 		  nummods, bufsiz = 8192,
139  | 		  new_file,
140  | 		  homelen, home_end, path_end;
141  | 
142  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
143  |     ErrorLogger(NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_Init, NULL);
144  | #endif
145  | 
146  |     /**
147  |      **  If called with no arguments and the flags don't say that there's some-
148  |      **  thing to do - exit now!
149  |      **/
150  |     if (argc < 1 && !(g_flags & (M_DISPLAY | M_CLEAR)))
151  | 	goto success0;
152  | 
153  |     /**
154  |      **  Parameter check for the initswitch command
155  |      **/
156  |     if (g_flags & M_SWITCH) {
157  | 	argc--;
158  | 	if (argc != 1)
159  | 	    if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC,
160  | 				  "initswitch oldmodule newmodule", NULL))
161  | 		goto unwind0;
162  |     }
163  | 
164  |     /**
165  |      **  Where's my HOME?
166  |      **/
167  |     if ((char *) NULL == (home = (char *) getenv("HOME")))
168  | 	if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_HOME, LOC, NULL))
169  | 	    goto unwind1;
170  | 
171  |     /**
172  |      **  Put HOME into a buffer and store a slash where the end of HOME is
173  |      **  for quick concatination of the shell startup files.
174  |      **/
175  |     homelen = strlen(home) + 40;
176  |     if ((char *) NULL ==
177  | 	(home_pathname = stringer(NULL, homelen, home, "/", NULL)))
178  | 	if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
179  | 	    goto unwind0;
180  | 
181  |     if ((char *) NULL == (home_pathname2 = stringer(NULL, homelen, NULL)))
182  | 	if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
183  | 	    goto unwind1;
184  | 
185  |     home_end = strlen(home_pathname);
186  | 
187  |     /**
188  |      **  Allocate a buffer for fgets ...
189  |      **/
190  |     if (NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, bufsiz, NULL)))
191  | 	if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
192  | 	    goto unwind2;
193  | 
194  |     /**
195  |      **  Scan all startup files related to the current invoking shell
196  |      **/
197  |     if ((char **) NULL == (shell_startups = SetStartupFiles(shell_name)))
198  | 	goto unwind3;
199  | 
200  |     while (shell_startups[shell_num]) {
201  | 	new_file = 1;
202  | 	found_modload_flag = 0;
203  | 
204  | 	if ((char *) NULL == stringer(home_pathname + home_end, 40,
205  | 				      shell_startups[shell_num], NULL))
206  | 	    if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
207  | 		goto unwind3;
208  | 
209  | 	if (NULL == (fileptr = fopen(home_pathname, "r")))
210  | 	    goto unwhile0; 	/** while( shell_startups) ...	     **/
211  | 
212  | 	/**
213  | 	 **  ... when the startup file exists ...
214  | 	 **  open a new startupfile with the extension -NEW for output
215  | 	 **/
216  | 	path_end = strlen(home_pathname);
217  | 	if ((char *) NULL == stringer(home_pathname + path_end,
218  | 				      homelen - path_end, "-NEW", NULL))
219  | 	    if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
220  | 		goto unwind3;
221  | 
222  | 	if (!(g_flags & M_DISPLAY) &&
223  | 	    ((FILE *) NULL == (newfileptr = fopen(home_pathname, "w")))) {
224  | 	    (void) ErrorLogger(ERR_OPEN, LOC, home_pathname,
225  | 		_(em_writing), NULL);
226  | 	    goto unwhile0; 	/** while( shell_startups) ...	     **/
227  | 	}
228  | 
229  | 	/**
230  | 	 **  Seek for a modules load|add command within the shell startup file
231  | 	 **  Copy the shell input file to the new one until the magic cookie
232  | 	 **  is found.
233  | 	 **/
234  | 	while (fgets(buffer, bufsiz, fileptr)) {
235  | 	    if (Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, modcmdPtr, buffer, buffer)) {
236  | 		found_modload_flag = 1;
237  | 		/**
238  | 		 **  ... module load|add found ...
239  | 		 **/
240  | 		found_module_command = 1;
241  | 
242  | 		/* print out the "module" part */
243  | 		(void) Tcl_RegExpRange(modcmdPtr, 1,
244  | 				       (CONST84 char **) &startp,
245  | 				       (CONST84 char **) &endp);
246  | 		if (!(g_flags & M_DISPLAY))
247  | 		    (void) out_substr(newfileptr, startp, endp);
248  | 
249  | 		/* print out the "add/load" part */
250  | 		(void) Tcl_RegExpRange(modcmdPtr, 2,
251  | 				       (CONST84 char **) &startp,
252  | 				       (CONST84 char **) &endp);
253  | 		if (!(g_flags & M_DISPLAY))
254  | 		    (void) out_substr(newfileptr, startp, endp);
255  | 
256  | 		if (!(g_flags & M_CLEAR)) {
257  | 		    /* look at the "module list" part */
258  | 		    (void) Tcl_RegExpRange(modcmdPtr, 3,
259  | 					   (CONST84 char **) &startp,
260  | 					   (CONST84 char **) &endp);
261  | 		    /* save the end character & set to 0 */
262  | 		    if (endp) {
263  | 			ch = *endp;
264  | 			*endp = '\0';
265  | 		    }
266  | 
267  | 		    if ((char **) NULL ==
268  | 		    (modlist = SplitIntoList(interp, startp, &nummods," \t")))
269  | 			continue; /** while(fgets) **/
270  | 
271  | 		    /* restore the list end character */
272  | 		    if (endp)
273  | 			*endp = ch;
274  | 
275  | 		    if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
276  | 			if (modlist[0] == NULL) {
277  | 			    fprintf(stderr,
278  | /* TRANSLATORS: don't rearrange the arguments */
279  | 	_("\nNo modules are loaded in %s's initialization file $HOME/%s\n"),
280  | 				    shell_name,shell_startups[shell_num]);
281  | 			} else {
282  | 			    if (new_file) {
283  | 				fprintf(stderr,
284  | /* TRANSLATORS: don't rearrange the arguments */
285  | 	_("\n%s initialization file $HOME/%s loads modules:\n\t"),
286  | 				    shell_name, shell_startups[shell_num]);
287  | 		    		(void) out_substr(stderr, startp, endp);
288  | 				fputs("\n",stderr);
289  | 				new_file = 0;
290  | 			    } else {
291  | 				fputs("\t",stderr);
292  | 		    		(void) out_substr(stderr, startp, endp);
293  | 				fputs("\n",stderr);
294  | 			    }
295  | 			}
296  | 
297  | 			FreeList(modlist, nummods);
298  | 			continue; /** while(fgets) **/
299  | 		    }
300  | 
301  | 		    for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
302  | 		    /**
303  | 		     ** Search through the modlist of modules that are currently
304  | 		     ** in the ~/.startup.  If one is found, it handles removing
305  | 		     ** it, switching it, etc.
306  | 		     **/
307  | 			for (j = 0; j < nummods; j++) {
308  | 			    if (modlist[j] && !strcmp(modlist[j], argv[i])) {
309  | 				if (g_flags & (M_LOAD | M_REMOVE)) {
310  | 				/**
311  | 				 **  If removing, adding, prepending it,
312  | 				 **  NULL it off the list.
313  | 				 **/
314  | 				    if (g_flags & M_REMOVE)
315  | 					fprintf(stderr, _("Removed %s\n"),
316  | 						modlist[j]);
317  | 				    else if ((g_flags & M_LOAD)
318  | 					     && !(g_flags & M_PREPEND))
319  | 					fprintf(stderr, _("Moving %s to end\n"),
320  | 						modlist[j]);
321  | 				    else if (g_flags & M_PREPEND)
322  | 					fprintf(stderr,
323  | 						_("Moving %s to beginning\n"),
324  | 						modlist[j]);
325  | 				    null_free((void *) (modlist + j));
326  | 
327  | 				} else if (g_flags & M_SWITCH) {
328  | 				/**
329  | 				 **  If switching it, swap the old string with
330  | 				 **  the new string in the list.
331  | 				 **/
332  | 				/* TRANSLATORS: don't rearrange the arguments */
333  | 				    fprintf(stderr, _("Switching %s to %s\n"),
334  | 					    modlist[j], argv[i + 1]);
335  | 				    null_free((void *) (modlist + j));
336  | 				    modlist[j]=stringer(NULL,0,argv[i+1],NULL);
337  | 				}
338  | 			    } /** if **/
339  | 			} /** for(j) **/
340  | 		    } /** for(i) **/
341  | 		/**
342  | 		 **  Ok, if we're removing it, prepending it, or switching it, 
343  | 		 **  the modlist contains what needs to be put where...
344  | 		 **/
345  | 		    if ((new_file) && (g_flags & M_PREPEND)) {
346  | 		    /**
347  | 		     **  PREPENDING
348  | 		     **/
349  | 			for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
350  | 			    fprintf(newfileptr, " %s", argv[i]);
351  | 			    final_list_num++;
352  | 			}
353  | 		    }
354  | 
355  | 		    if ((g_flags & (M_LOAD | M_REMOVE | M_SWITCH))) {
356  | 		    /**
357  | 		     **  DUMP LIST
358  | 		     **/
359  | 			for (j = 0; j < nummods; j++) {
360  | 			    if (modlist[j]) {
361  | 				fprintf(newfileptr, " %s", modlist[j]);
362  | 				final_list_num++;
363  | 			    }
364  | 			}
365  | 		    }
366  | 		    if ((new_file) && (g_flags & M_LOAD)
367  | 		    && !(g_flags & M_PREPEND)) {
368  | 		    /**
369  | 		     **  ADDING
370  | 		     **/
371  | 			for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
372  | 			    fprintf(newfileptr, " %s", argv[i]);
373  | 			    final_list_num++;
374  | 			}
375  | 		    }
376  | 		    /* always place a null if an empty list */
377  | 		    if (!final_list_num)
378  | 			fprintf(newfileptr, " %s", "null");
379  | 
380  | 		    FreeList(modlist, nummods);
381  | 
382  | 		} else { /** if( M_CLEAR) **/
383  | 		/**
384  | 		 ** Clear out the list, but leave a "null"
385  | 		 **/
386  | 		    fprintf(newfileptr, " %s", "null");
387  | 		}
388  | 	/**
389  | 	 **  Restore any comments at the end of the line...
390  | 	 **/
391  | 		(void) Tcl_RegExpRange(modcmdPtr, 4,
392  | 				       (CONST84 char **) &startp,
393  | 				       (CONST84 char **) &endp);
394  | 		(void) out_substr(newfileptr, startp, endp);
395  | 		new_file = 0;
396  | 	    } else {		/* not module load line */
397  | 		if (!(g_flags & M_DISPLAY))
398  | 		    fputs(buffer, newfileptr);
399  | 	    }
400  | 	} /** while (fgets) **/
401  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
402  | 	    fputs("\n",stderr);
403  | 	}
404  | 
405  | 	if (!found_modload_flag) {
406  | 	    /**
407  | 	     **  If not found...
408  | 	     **/
409  | 	    if (EOF == fclose(fileptr))
410  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_CLOSE, LOC, home_pathname, NULL))
411  | 		    goto unwind3;
412  | 
413  | 	    if (!(g_flags & M_DISPLAY)) {
414  | 		if (EOF == fclose(newfileptr))
415  | 		    if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_CLOSE, LOC, home_pathname, NULL))
416  | 			goto unwind3;
417  | 
418  | 		if (0 > unlink(home_pathname))
419  | 		    if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_UNLINK, LOC, home_pathname, NULL))
420  | 			goto unwind3;
421  | 	    }
422  | 	} else {		/* found_modload_flag */
423  | 	    /**
424  | 	     **  Don't need these any more
425  | 	     **/
426  | 	    if (EOF == fclose(fileptr))
427  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_CLOSE, LOC, home_pathname, NULL))
428  | 		    goto unwind3;
429  | 
430  | 	    if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY)
431  | 	        goto unwhile0; 	/** while( shell_startups) ...	     **/
432  | 
433  | 	    if (EOF == fclose(newfileptr))
434  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_CLOSE, LOC, home_pathname, NULL))
435  | 		    goto unwind3;
436  | 
437  | 	    /**
438  | 	     **  Truncate -NEW from home_pathname and Create a -OLD name
439  | 	     **  Move ~/.startup to ~/.startup-OLD
440  | 	     **/
441  | 	    home_pathname[path_end] = '\0';
442  | 
443  | 	    if ((char *) NULL == stringer(home_pathname2, homelen,
444  | 					  home_pathname, "-OLD", NULL))
445  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
446  | 		    goto unwind3;
447  | 
448  | 	    if (0 > rename(home_pathname, home_pathname2))
449  | 		if (OK !=
450  | 		    ErrorLogger(ERR_RENAME, LOC, home_pathname, home_pathname2,
451  | 				NULL))
452  | 		    goto unwind3;
453  | 
454  | 	    /**
455  | 	     **  Create a -NEW name
456  | 	     **  Move ~/.startup-NEW to ~/.startup
457  | 	     **/
458  | 	    if ((char *) NULL == stringer(home_pathname2, homelen,
459  | 					  home_pathname, "-NEW", NULL))
460  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
461  | 		    goto unwind3;
462  | 
463  | 	    if (0 > rename(home_pathname2, home_pathname)) {
464  | 		if (OK !=
465  | 		    ErrorLogger(ERR_RENAME, LOC, home_pathname2, home_pathname,
466  | 				NULL)) {
467  | 		    /**
468  | 		     **  Put the -OLD one back if I can't rename it
469  | 		     **/
470  | 		    if ((char *) NULL == stringer(home_pathname2, homelen,
471  | 						  home_pathname, "-OLD", NULL))
472  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
473  | 			    goto unwind3;
474  | 
475  | 		    if (0 > rename(home_pathname2, home_pathname))
476  | 			ErrorLogger(ERR_RENAME, LOC, home_pathname2,
477  | 				    home_pathname, NULL);
478  | 
479  | 		    goto unwind3;
480  | 		}
481  | 	    }
482  | 
483  | 	    /**
484  | 	     **  So far we're successful so
485  | 	     **  Create a -OLD name
486  | 	     **  Unlink ~/.startup-OLD
487  | 	     **/
488  | 	    if ((char *) NULL == stringer(home_pathname2, homelen,
489  | 					  home_pathname, "-OLD", NULL))
490  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
491  | 		    goto unwind3;
492  | 
493  | 	    if ((g_flags & (M_CLEAR | M_LOAD | M_REMOVE | M_SWITCH)))
494  | 		if (0 > unlink(home_pathname2)) {
495  | 		    ErrorLogger(ERR_UNLINK, LOC, home_pathname2, NULL);
496  | 		    goto unwind3;
497  | 		}
498  | 	}
499  |     unwhile0:
500  | 	shell_num++;
501  |     } /** while( shell_startups) **/
502  | 
503  |     /**
504  |      **  Free up internal I/O buffers
505  |      **/
506  |     null_free((void *) &buffer);
507  | 
508  |     if (!found_module_command)
509  | 	if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_INIT_STUP, LOC, shell_name, NULL))
510  | 	    goto unwind2;
511  | 
512  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
513  |     ErrorLogger(NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_Init, NULL);
514  | #endif
515  | 
516  |     /**
517  |      **  Free up memory
518  |      **/
519  |     null_free((void *) &home_pathname2);
520  |     null_free((void *) &home_pathname);
521  | 
522  | success0:
523  |     return (TCL_OK);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
524  | 
525  | unwind3:
526  |     null_free((void *) &buffer);
527  | unwind2:
528  |     null_free((void *) &home_pathname2);
529  | unwind1:
530  |     null_free((void *) &home_pathname);
531  | unwind0:
532  |     return (TCL_ERROR);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
533  | 
534  | } /** end of 'ModuleCmd_Init' **/
